awd_titl_txt: CISE Research Instrumentation:  Massively Parallel Real     Time Computer Vision
awd_abstract_narration: This award is to purchase a multi-processor host machine                   for the Maspar computer and real-time high-speed, image                         capture and display hardware in order to support research in                    parallel real-time, high-speed computer vision and                              visualization.  The upgraded Maspar system will enable                          research to be conducted in the areas of artificial neural                      networks for robotics, factorization methods for shape and                      motion from image streams, road and terrain navigation,                         visualization techniques for relativistic imaging, and the                      development of a stereo vision machine.                                                                                                                         Research in parallel real-time computer vision and                              visualization is computationally expensive and requires both                    massively parallel computational power and real-time image                      I/O support.  Carnegie Mellon University will be upgrading                      their Maspar computer and adding real-time image acquisition                    hardware to support research projects in these areas.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
